name: Beachcomber Beach Resort & Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at hotel around noon and were lucky enough to be able to book in and get room straight away, Reception staff member Debbie was super friendly and nice. The room was lovely and clean and really comfortable. We had lunch at Jimmy B's which was tasty and quick, Sara behind the bar was also friendly and nice. Live music started at 3.30pm with a solo male singer playing guitar who was fab. Sat at the bar in afternoon reading a book and relaxing to his singing. The hotel has two pools and is on the beach so spolit for choice of where to soak up the sun. We also went to the sister hotel, Grand Plaza at sundown where we have a voucher from hotel for a free drink and got a complimentary 'sundown shooter'. On return to Beachcomber after dinner we sat in bar and watched a band perform who were also good. Every single member of staff we met were friendly and polite from the bar staff to the cleaners.....Would definately recommend this hotel and hopefully we will still manage to get a room when we return to St Petes next year. lol. A truly fantastic, relaxing stay and worth every dollar. Well done!!
reviews.title: Wow! Need I say more?

reviews.text: Great place with the best bar and location you could ask for. Staff at Jimmy Bs the best and friendly. Well priced drinks and the view and music is A plus. Hotel is not brand new but well kept , clean and decent price. One of my faves. Can be loud at night but its not a retirement home.
reviews.title: Heaven on the Beach

reviews.text: we stayed at the beachcomber from june 4th til the 11th and service here is amazing. from the front desk to the maintenance people, everyone was helpful. you really cant' beat the price for what you pay for a place on the beach. the room was small, but it was very clean. my only complaint about the room is that it was in need of fans, a ceiling fan and a bathroom fan, we had to have the air on all the time and i am a freeze baby so i was cold most of the time- when we were in the room. we hung out at jimmy b's quite a bit because it had a fun atmosphere and the bartenders were personable (torre and sarah, can't remember the other bartenders' names!). i will be returning very soon!
reviews.title: fun spot!

reviews.text: I will give a totally honest review. It is on the beach but from our room it wasn't viewable. I was disappointed in the room. Very small and outdated. It was clean. Very short on plugs in any room. The grounds were pretty nice, the outside bar and music was enjoyable. The staff was all pleasant. I personally would just like a fresher up to date room, not so gloomy. If they did some remodeling it would be an amazing place.
reviews.title: Typical beach hotel

reviews.text: We ate at Morgans just up the street. Coupons on restaurant.com All fresh food and large quantities.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: We have been staying here for several years because it is home away from home! The staff welcomes you year after year, you do not have the change over of staff like most places. Even the grounds people and housekeepers are the same people from year to year. We took our children here and now our children are taking their children. It is very family oriented. Even though Jimmy B's is so well know on the beach and to the locals and everyone goes there at least for one drink a night :) I have never seen or heard of any problems. After dark I love the fact that there is security walking around although I have never heard of them being needed it just gives us our family a secure feeling. For the price, and how clean and updated the rooms, the grounds and the pools are this Resort should definitely be a 5 Star. I recommend it to anyone going to St. Pete Beach!
reviews.title: We absolutely love this Resort!!

reviews.text: The Beachcomber Hotel in St. Pete Beach is well worth staying at. You cannot tell how beautiful it is from the street. From when you first walk into the lobby and are greeted with such nice hotel reps - to when you walk through - It is a beautiful resort - you will feel like you are in paradise. Everyone who works there is so cordial and makes sure that you are satisfied with your stay. They have Jimmy B's Beach Bar which plays music in the afternoons and then in the evenings. The price is so reasonable for the rooms - but book early to get that reasonable price! It feels like a home away from home!! We will stay at the Beachcomber Hotel every year. They want you to come back and they make you really feel that you want to go back!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in St. Pete Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel was great the service was excellent the hotel was right on the beach would recommend the resort to everyone ill be back again before the summer is over
reviews.title: outstanding resort hotel wanna stay again

reviews.text: The Beachcomber far exceeded our expectations. It is not only clean with a friendly and helpful staff, but was also a beautiful place. We have already started plans for a return trip next month. I would highly recommend it ti everyone!!!!
reviews.title: Most incredible vacation spot!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro: Staff was very nice and helpful. The Sports Bar is great. The food seems to come out of the same kitchen at the to bars, but it's pretty good. Room was clean. Short walk to some good restaurants. Beach seemed to be well kept. Room prices were reasonable.
reviews.title: very crowded

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel a lot over the last few years. The rooms aren't the greatest but we like the place. I just returned from there with nothing but issues, so many issues I'll never return. You can only have one car (which they never told us) you have to pay $30 a vehicle for any addt'l car. Huge issues over what you can or can't have at the pool. Depending on who you speak will depend on what rules are being enforced. What it comes down to is the only want you to purchase all beverages and food from them and they will make you life miserable until you do. Then god forbid you want to walk to the beach while Jimmy B is busy cause you can't return to your OWN room with what you went through with. They would not allow me to return to my room with the drink I originally went to the beach with. I did not want to stay at Jimmy B, I just wanted to go to my damn room.
reviews.title: Will NEVER stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful soft sand, friendly service, plenty of beautiful shells, and calm and clear water. Air conditioning is ice cold, rooms are simple but clean, garden area in central courtyard is nice and quiet. We stayed in a room near the lobby, which was further away from the pool and the bar, and made it nice and quiet at night. The beach is right out the back of the hotel, with cabanas for rent or bring your own blanket/chairs. This area of the beach is quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the Tradewinds Hotel beach activities further south. There is a 7-11 across the street for small purchases and ice cream (Larry's was yummy) and restaurants (Snappers was good but a little pricey) within walking distance. Room for improvement: mattresses are soft and could use replacing and curtains for windows could use modifications to block out all the exterior light. Overall it was a good value and we would come back.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: The rooms were poor, beds were extremely uncomfortable. Location was nice. The shower water was cold and wouldn't turn hot. The restaurant by the beach was good. Would rather stay at the Trade Winds next door. Bar was kind of scary. Won't stay their again. There is a nice beach though. A/C was loud.
reviews.title: Nothing compared to the brand hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was next to the bar, Jimmy B's and it was extremely loud. They play music 7 nights a week until 2 a.m. I'm three months pregnant and tried to change my room several times, but they wouldn't allow it. I wanted a nice, relaxing weekend, but instead there were tons of people screaming, yelling and partying all night. The room was disguisting and had tons of bugs all over the bed. My advice spend some more and stay at Trade Winds. This place is a dump!
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!
Better than the "big name" hotels around
reviews.text: At first, it looks like a run down old hotel trying to stay afloat next to two massive, remodeled hotels, which it is. Once entering the doors, you forget about what the outside looks like and lobby is really nice, with computers for your use, concierge and the grounds were really beautiful. The room was more spacious than the other hotel we stayed at next door and with a full kitchen (full size fridge, oven/range, microwave etc), walk in closet that was not short on space and an actual bathroom that did not feel like a airplanes restroom, it was a great place to stay. The rooms are obviously old, like from the 70's due to the wiring and paint, but my picky wife who likes the "yuppie hotels" was more pleased with this than our next hotel. There were two pools that were fenced in for little ones not to run in, with rafts and kiddie floats, a live music bar with decent food was there. Parking was rough, very limited and a decent walk from start to finish if your wanting easy access to the beach.

The grounds were absolutely fabulous with beautiful palm trees and bamboo trees. It was so tropical with beautiful bushes with beautiful flowers with purple and white so very pretty!! There were all these butterflies which I thought was really cool!! The pools were awesome!! We all enjoyed swimming and we had so much fun in and around the pool areas. Jimmy B's was excellent for entertainment and food and drinks. The chicken wings were excellent and the Pina Coladas were great!! We loved the fact that there was entertainment twice a day and we love music so this was a real hit with us!! Players restaurant was great for my husband and son as they played pool a few times during our stay!! The sunsets were so beautiful from the resort and we snapped so many pictures! A man proposed to his girlfriend one night right at Jimmy B's as the sun was setting!! This was so cool and we were standing right next to them. The king bed was very comfortable and the shower was great!! The rooms need a little work as our door needed to be replaced. The staff at the Beachcomber were very professional and very friendly and accomodating!! I would highly recommend this Resort to other travellers. We will most definately return to the Beachcomber Resort in April of 2010!!
reviews.title: This Resort was fabulous with all you needed right on the premises!!

reviews.text: The two pools were nice, the location was nice and the people behind the desk were very nice. However the room was a dump. The carpet was dirty, the grout in bathroom was black and/or cracked, the tub faucet was falling off and it was just bad! The window A/C was on full blast and wasn't cooling the room. We had a cold spell during our trip and switched the control to "heat". We almost fell over from the putrid smell that came out of the unit and immediately turned it off. Would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Good location - needs major renovation

reviews.text: I paid top dollar $300 a night for a view and a short walk to the ocean.
reviews.title: Friendly people but Beachcomber is too old and way overpriced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room - small, dark, dingy, nothing worked and kitchen was unsanitary to say the least. I usually go to CA but decided to give FL a try, For the price and the time spent flying I could stay at a beautiful beachfront condo for a week in San Diego.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not a frill and fluff person and can be completely happy with the basics.
reviews.title: my stay in paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the 3rd June in a row, we spent 4 nites at the Beachcomber resort. From the booking to the checking out, it was another fine experience. The rooms are more than adequate, although certainly not plush. What makes this resort special, are the beautiful, landscaped grounds leading to the beach, which is very broad. One can rent covered chaises for $18/day or $12/after 2. Jimmy B's is a great beach bar (with food) right on thebeach. The rates are low, the stay is fine.
reviews.title: Another fine stay.

reviews.text: The room was great!! We had 2 full size beds, A kitchenette with everything furnished. We had a great balcony view of the garden. The room service was awesome! Loved the stay. The garden view and the pools as well as Jimmy's Bar
reviews.title: Best Resort Best Sleep Best Price Best of the Best

reviews.text: This was my 4th time staying here :)
reviews.title: Friendly, clean and fun for all-right on the Gulf of Mexico.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This used to be a Best Western Inn awhile back. Some of the internet sites still have it listed like that, so check the address, when you are looking into this hotel.
reviews.title: Most Relaxing Week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly. They allow you to come early, before your check-in time, and use their pool, beach area, restaurant, etc., until your room is ready ! Room very clean. Mini-fridge, coffee pot, nice T. V., hair dryer , table, 2 chairs and comfortable beds in BASIC-STANDARD room. Cabana rental for $ 18.00 a day on beach-well worth it, to avoid sunburn and backache ! Their cabanas are basically 2 comfy,cushioned lounge chairs, with an adjustable overhang depending on how much sun you want.
reviews.title: WE WERE VERY SATISFIED

reviews.text: This was our third year staying at the Beachcomber. It is clearly an older property and not very swanky, but has been kept well. Free parking, free internet, two pools (one very large one and one smaller, quieter one), beautiful grounds, and right on the beach! Half of the rooms have full kitchens, which is very convenient. The bathrooms have a large window sill which are great for setting all of your toiletries where they are out of the way. And the rooms with kitchens have walk in closets - makes your room feel more like home and makes it so that you don't have to live out of your suitcase. The rooms are clean, the staff was very friendly, and the location is perfect. I'm not sure that there is a more reasonable place to stay that is directly on the beach. Another review I read suggested that this is not a family friendly place - I would disagree! There were plenty of kids at the place, and all seemed to be having a great time. If you're looking for a quieter room, ask for the courtyard view, which is actually cheaper as well. The beach bar at the end of the property has live music every night, but in our courtyard room w/the door closed, you could not here the music.
reviews.title: Third year here - great place!

reviews.text: What they do not tell you on line is that there is a huge bar on both ends of this resort - the one on the back must be walked through to get to the beach. On our first night, there were around 300 twenty somethings drunk in this back bar - drunk, dancing and making out. Not a family friendly enviroment.
reviews.title: Not a Family Friendly resort! Beware!

reviews.text: The rooms were semi - clean, although the bath tub still had hairs in it from previous guests.
reviews.title: Great beachside resort to relax and get away from the grind.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, the beach just outside complex was covered in condom wrappers. We got our family out of here as quickly as possible!
reviews.title: Perfect Summer Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my 81 year old mother to the beach midweek for 4 days and we had a great time. The room was clean and roomy and we felt very secure. The pool was steps away from our door and the gulf beach as close as a walk to the mailbox. The service people were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the nightly entertainment and the tropical atmoshere. We are planning a return trip!
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent my birthday here on our Florida road trip and it was one of the best birthdays ever. The rooms are okay but the location is awesome and its just a really fun hotel to stay at. Loved the pools. We were there on a weekend and the place was really lively with live bands playing at the beach bar. At first i had intended to stay at the postcard inn next door, but the beach comber was much cheaper and i did not regret my choice. You can still have dinner at TPI's bbq restaurant which is pretty awesome. Will return to this place on my next Florida trip!
reviews.title: Fun hotel!

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. My girlfriend and I had a room on the first floor facing the courtyard. The 2 pools were a few steps away. The room was small, but clean and we had a small refrigerator which was nice for keeping drinks and snacks cold. The hotel is right on the beach, but I didn't see any rooms that had a nice view of the beach. The beach bar, Jimmy B's is in between the rooms and the beach. There are chairs and cabanas on the beach that you can rent if you want. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right on the beach. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly and the restaurant and bars are reasonable with good bar style food. There are also other restaurants within walking distance. Jimmy B's, their beachfront bar, has great bands and friendly bartenders. We will definitely go stay there again.
reviews.title: Great beachfront hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are older but very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The staff was friendly and really went above and beyond their job to help you. The location is very convenient with a 711 across the street and also convenient to many restaurants and stores. We had a garden view room on the bottom floor which was perfect for us and allowed our 3 year old to have a place to play so she wasn't so confined to the room while we were there. I do not recommend this hotel for those looking for very quiet seeing as the bar does play music all day and night but that worked in our favor b/c we didn't feel so bad if our 3 year old was a little loud. The beach is very nice with lots of shells for the kids to pick up and cabanas to rent. We liked that it is a small resort and the staff knows who you are! We will be coming back again!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were attending the Tiki Beach Party 2 event at the hotel next door, and in doing my research for a place to stay for the night, I almost overlooked the Beachcomber! Sure glad I didn't, because the Beachcomber is a wonderful resort, with decent sized rooms, comfy beds, kitchenettes (in our room, anyway), two pools, attractive landscaping, a great bar, comedy , and direct access to one of the most beautiful beaches anywhere. The place was clean and well maintained. Every member of the staff we interacted with was great...very polite and helpful with info about the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: This was my family's sixth year at The Beachcomber, and we plan to return next year. I'm a bit surprised about the poor reviews I've read.
reviews.title: We are return guests, and we'll be back again next year!

reviews.text: Yes, this is an older property, but it is well maintained. The rooms could be updated with flat screen tv's, bedding, etc, but how much time do you really spend in your room if you're at the beach? The room was clean. That was most important to me and my family.
reviews.title: One simple word: Crappy

reviews.text: The parking issue is common with the small hotels that are located right on the beach. Yes, it is diagonal parking one way, but if you're not comfortable with the idea of backing all of the way out, there is parking available at the front of the property. The Beachcomber is located directly on the beach - what do you expect?
reviews.title: Vintage Feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are great. The smaller pool tends to be mostly adults, which makes for a nice, relaxing area for us adults. Never once did I see any employee try to impose rules about what you could and couldn't have in the pool (outside of glass containers). In fact, there is a box at the large pool that is a 'take it and leave it' box where you can find a float for the duration of your stay and leave it behind for someone else when you're done.
reviews.title: We Were Lied to and Overcharged More than $140

reviews.text: The garden and fountain area are very pretty and are probably the quietest rooms. There is live music from mid afternoon until about 11pm. If you require a quiet room, reserve a fountain/garden view room....although Jimmy B's has some great performers in to play music!
reviews.title: Okay...but wouldn't return.

reviews.text: This is my family's 5th year at The Beachcomber and we love it!
reviews.title: Great hotel on the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it is an older hotel, it is in great condition and very well kept. The garden/courtyard is very well maintained and the staff takes great care of the landscaping. The rooms are average size and nothing fancy, but clean. We always stay in a room with a kitchen, so that gives us some extra room.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff is incredibly friendly. It was great to see housekeeping work as a team. And the front desk staff was very friendly. Upon our arrival, there was a leak in our bathroom from the room above us letting their bathtub run over. Maintenance addressed the issue immediately and came back the next morning to make sure that the leak had stopped.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: The property is right on the beach and very affordable. The parking is a bit tricky, but this is the downfall of being located right on the beach. The majority of the other hotels on the beach have their parking set up the same way. If you don't want to park along the side of the property and be forced to back out, there is a lot at the front of the property - you will just have to walk further to your room.
reviews.title: Not that great, will not go back!

reviews.text: Having two pools is a great option. The smaller pool tends to be the 'adult' or quiet pool and at times made it feel like you were at your own private pool as opposed to a pool at a hotel. There's also a 'take it or leave it' box at the big pool where guests can leave floats, noodles, and pool toys for other guests to use. We didn't buy a float or noodle while we were there because we just borrowed them from the box.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay

reviews.text: The Beachcomber is a clean, affordable, two star hotel with some bonus ammenities. This resort for is not for families with young children or teens as it's kind of a party spot, but could be a good choice for adults who enjoy nightlife/bar scene. Our group of six adults spent four nights at the Beachcomber in mid-April and had a good experience. For the most part, we found the staff to be friendly, hard-working and helpful. We did attempt to order snacks around 9:00 pm in the sports bar and were met with some eye-rolls, so we chose to take our business (and money) outside the resort that evening. The hotel is conviently located close to a 7-11, liqour store and several resturants all within walking distance. The lobby, grounds and beach were well maintained and beautiful. The walkway leading toward the beach was an excellent spot to enjoy a drink and watch the amazing sunsets. Jimmy B's provideds free "sunset shooters" every evening just before sunset - very tasty! Rooms were a bit dated but clean with comfortable beds. On-site entertainment at Jimmy B's was hit or miss - there was a one man guitar player who was rather good, but we found the Reggie Band to be "sad" and "unentertaining" - but this entertainment is free so that's a big plus. Jimmy B's attracts many of the locals and was very busy on Friday and Saturday nights which made for an interesting "people watching" experience for our group. The one major flaw with this hotel is the parking - spots are very small and few. We liked that the hotel detered non-guests from entering the lot on the busy weekend evenings.
reviews.title: Good Times at the Beachcomber

reviews.text: Yes, this is an older property but it has been well maintained and the grounds are beautiful. I stayed here 20 years ago and found it to be in better shape now than then.
reviews.title: Two Rooms, Two Nights, Two Good Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are small but efficient. Bathrooms were very small but who spends time in the bathroom. There was some loose caulking and some chipped tiles but it was clean.
reviews.title: Great amenities ,Music and Staff !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach bar was fantasic and lively all afternoon and evening. However, we had a pool view room and did not hear the music at all. We did hear some talking in the courtyard but nothing overly loud. Players, the sports bar, was also busy at night and hed plenty of tv's to watch whatever sport you wanted.
reviews.title: Great value, fun place, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the beach bar, Jimmy B's, was okay. Standard bar food. Nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation with friendly staff

reviews.text: The service was terrible , they have no elevator ,and their site does not state that , so if you have a second floor room,and your older, beware, you have to drag your suitcases up a back alley entrance with cramped parking and they offer no help until you have already brought your luggage up!! There is no security in the alley for your protection if you leave and go out,very unsafe.The room was only ok, clean tho.The staff was'nt very helpful and even snickered when we called to ask how we were to get our suitcases up the stairs, they stated carry them up, it was my sister and myself ,i am 62 yrs. old and it was very trying , not a good start to a vacation ,and the 187.00 a night was truly not worth it. We were totally disappointed.Make sure you read your 24 hr. notice,they are out to get your money.Looks are deceiving on their site.We ended up at the SIRRATA down the strip which we got a better deal and will go back every year at their resort.The employees there were wonderful and even let us in early.
reviews.title: We'LL NEVER GO BACK!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel for a inexpensive Florida getaway. Def. "Old Florida" and the service was great! Food at the bar was good as well. Rooms were comfortable. Would def. go again for a weekend getaway. The Beach Bar was good. Got a little loud at times but overall great service.
reviews.title: Great Price and Excellent Service

reviews.text: I went to this hotel with my family and had a blast. The location was great, right on the beach and the tiki bar and live music was awesome. There are some complaints though. The way the hotel is set up is weird because in order to get towels you have to go up to the hotel in the front street area to get towels for the pool then go back down to the pool area. Also, right next door to us people were smoking the whole time outside there room and our room smelled bad, way to close to be a non smoking room right next door! Also the pool was dirty, it was so cloudy you could not see the bottom and there was some ugly filter thing sitting at the stairs with tubes hanging out of it into the pool. It must have been broken.
reviews.title: Could be a great place with some changes

reviews.text: Everyone at the beachcomber, from the front desk, to housekeeping, wait staff, was so nice and made us feel very welcomed.
reviews.title: My sister and I enjoyed our stay, we can't wait to come back next year and bring friends and family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean and was kept up daily. My daughter came to visit and stayed the night and hotel management waived the fee. That was so nice. Good Karma!
reviews.title: We truly enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Beachcomber and we had a blast!! It was very clean, and we got a great walk in rate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Having 2 pools and being right on the beach was a definite plus! Also, there is a live band every day which was really nice. I would HIGHLY recommend!
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the family atmosphere, also perfect for couples. The rooms were very clean, the grounds and courtyard were well kept up and spotless clean. Very attractive lobby and the staff very friendly. The couple we were with, enjoyed the pool, we enjoyed the beach, we had perfect access to both and still got to enjoy being together. I look forward to going back.
reviews.title: We definitely would go back, have recommended to others.

reviews.text: The room was very clean and the outside area was very pleasant and well maintained.
reviews.title: Had a great family vacation and plan to return very soon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My great partner and I stayed at the Beachcomber for 4 nights and overall I'd have to give it 2/2-3 stars. Their were 2 pools, although one of them seemed like a large bathtub. The main pool was full of families and young kids, having fun but loud. If this is the kind of sunning you want to do, then the Beachcomber is for you. We chose to enjoy the clean, warm( 86 degree ) Gulf Of Mexico beach and ocean. The beach at the hotel was well kept, and swimming in the Gulf was a pure delight! The only complaint I had was the skimpy towels that the hotel offers for the pool or the beach. Sugesstion: Bring your own beach towels or be prepared to pick one up at any one of the local beach apparel and supply shops, or even better a CVS or Walgreens that line Gulf Blvd. Overall, I'd reccomend St. Petes beach to families.Oh yeah. The hotel does offer a Tiki bar between the pool and the beach, which offered live music from the mid afternoon till about 10:00 on all the nights we were there, although we didn't feel much attraction. We were looking for a place that had a Tiki feel, but this was not it.
reviews.title: Decent Place. Geared towards families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned every day, and rough clean towels were left for us. The first day we stepped into the room, their was a strong smell of curry, which either we got use to, or replaced with our aromas.( the apple pomegranite body spray that my partner used, helped alot) I did notice a dog barking in the next room on the first night we were there, and was not aware that this was a pet friendly hotel. I love dogs, but don't care to hear them first thing in the morning.You might want to question the hotel about this policy.
reviews.title: Always Stay At The Beachcomber!

aka: Beachcomber Beach Hotel Saint Pete Beach
description: The Beachcomber Beach Resort Hotel is located on 5 1/2 acres of beautifully tropical landscaped gardens. From the first glimpse of the beautiful, white sandy beach and the blue waters of the Gulf of Mexico to the welcoming smiles of all of our associates, you will feel relaxed and glad to be here. The Beachcomber offers rooms overlooking the Tropical Landscaped Gardens, the Swimming Pool, or the white sandy Beach. Each of our guest rooms has two double beds, a small refrigerator, coffee maker with complimentary coffee, iron and ironing board, hairdryer, large closet, AM/FM clock radio, Flat Screen TV with free HBO, free local calls, and unlimited wireless internet access. In addition, guest rooms with full kitchens are available. The kitchen rooms have the same amenities as a standard plus: a microwave, toaster, stove with oven, dining table with chairs for 4, and all necessary kitchen ware. There are NO hidden resort fees and NO parking fees. There are two heated swimming pools with chaise loungers, an on-site fitness center, an on-site guest laundry facility, complimentary coffee served daily in the lobby.
